intro: Leptopus philippinensis, commonly known as the Philippine sea hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are ovate and have a smooth texture, while its flowers bloom in clusters at the ends of the branches. This species is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to saline environments, making it an important plant in coastal ecosystems.
